page.title: 02BROADLANDS - ROMSEY
page.content: The present house at Broadlands is a fine 18th century palladian mansion begun in 1767 by the 1st Viscount Palmerston. The work of landscaping the 400 acres site was started by William Kent and later Capability Brown under the direction of the 2nd Viscount Palmerston. The old Jacobean Manor house was encased in white brick with fine porticos and entrance hall designed by Henry Holland. Robert Adam supervised much of the interior of the house. The late Edwina Ashley married the late Earl Mountbatten and Broadlands became their family home where they entertained many Royal visitors. The house was opened to the public in 1979 and after Earl Mountbatten's assassination in the same year, the present owners are Lord and Lady Romsey.
